title: Homemade Chocolate Syrup
description: I thought I’d give Homemade Chocolate Syrup because my 16 year old man-child uses it for his protein shakes and it’s getting crazy expensive. Store-bought chocolate syrup averages somewhere between $6-8 here my are of California. I already had a surplus of sugar and cocoa powder in my pantry, so why not make some?? Don’t get me started on how much chips cost… During the pandemic (ugh), I learned how to make Simple Vanilla Ice Cream. We went through a whole sundae phase and I didn’t think to make homemade chocolate syrup cuz we don’t use it as much as we do now. Add a couple of spoonfuls to milk chocolate milk. Add some to your coffee for a mocha. My favorite way? Frothed in my frother with oat milk for an afternoon pick-me-up. I like knowing that we are almost always 20 minutes away from a batch of homemade chocolate syrup…This counts as a meal prep item, right? Ingredients involved! Mix everything together except for the vanilla! Magic happens over the stove. You’re going to reduce it! Takes about 15-20 mins. When it has thickened up nicely, add the vanilla. Let cool. Let’s put it in a jar for safe keeping! Afternoons are better… When you have homemade chocolate syrup in your fridge! I thought I’d give Homemade Chocolate Syrup because my 16 year old man-child uses it for his protein shakes and it’s getting crazy expensive.  Store-bought chocolate syrup averages somewhere between $6-8 here my are of California.  I already had a surplus of sugar and cocoa powder in my pantry, so why not make some??  Don’t get me started on how much chips cost…

During the pandemic (ugh), I learned how to make Simple Vanilla Ice Cream. We went through a whole sundae phase and I didn’t think to make homemade chocolate syrup cuz we don’t use it as much as we do now. 

Add a couple of spoonfuls to milk chocolate milk. Add some to your coffee for a mocha. My favorite way?  Frothed in my frother with oat milk for an afternoon pick-me-up. I like knowing that we are almost always 20 minutes away from a batch of homemade chocolate syrup…This counts as a meal prep item, right?

Ingredients involved! 

Mix everything together except for the vanilla! 

Magic happens over the stove.  You’re going to reduce it! Takes about 15-20 mins. 

When it has thickened up nicely, add the vanilla. Let cool. 

Let’s put it in a jar for safe keeping! 

Afternoons are better…

When you have homemade chocolate syrup in your fridge! 

Homemade Chocolate Syrup

makes about 2 cups

recipe adapted from All Recipes 

  • 1 ½ cups water
  • 1 cup white sugar
  • 1 cup cocoa powder
  • 1 dash salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Combine water, sugar, cocoa powder, and salt in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Whisk continuously until the mixture reaches a gentle boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and continue whisking while allowing it to simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the syrup thickens to your desired consistency.
